data.title: Was our all time favorite, now not so much
data.text: They are not what they used to be. This was our very favorite place to eat. The salsa is still fabulous, and of course their Ceaser Salad but it has gone downhill. The menu is expensive, servings small and not as good as they once were. The food is OK, but I think it is better to go to Rosaritos down the street.

data.title: This restaurant maintains a good crowd on most nights...
data.text:
Usually the service is pretty good, with the exception of a couple of times wherein the server did not offer or refresh my beverage and it took forever to get our check.  

The food is pretty good, with decent prices, and even better when they send out coupons, via their email club.

Many go here to celebrate birthdays and they have good group accomodations....

data.title: Reliably good Cal-Mex
data.text: The surroundings are pleasant -- there is the bar-side with sports on TV and a dining side that is larger and a bit quieter. I have been here quite a few times because I know that I will always have (at least) a satisfactory meal and often a really good one. I have always had excellent servers. This restaurant provides a reliably pleasant dining experience. The food, while not trying to be daring, is exactly what I want when I choose to dine there.

data.title: very tasty
data.text: the food was great staff friendly, the prices are awesome and the location is great...clean bathrooms, big portions,

data.title: Cadiallac Margaritas are IT
data.text: This place is great for their Cadillac margaritas. Smooth when they add the Grand Marnier on the side. Easy to drink. Expensive though. Food is decent. The fajitas are delish. Can't go wrong with them..My one gripe is service. sometimes they are too slow or have an attitude like they are doing me the favor by waiting on me.

data.title: Bogo for my birthday
data.text:
We like going to this restaurant for many different occasions, from just two of us or four of us to bringing our entire family from out of town along. We've been going to this location for many years now, but this review is from the last time we were there. 

Since we are signed up to the e-newsletter, we get coupons in our email all the time. And this time it was one of our birthdays -we got a buy-one-get-one-free-entreé coupon. The staff was very nice and knowledgable about all the food they offer. When they heard about the birthday, they brought out a free dessert with a candle and 5 of the wait staff came to our table to sing at the end of our main course.

We love going there and we recommend it for pretty much any occasion, especially if it's your birthday!

data.title: No Surprises
data.text: Fast service. Fair range of standard Mexican food options. Happy hour is only in the bar so ask before going to a table. Free chips and salsa. Really noisy and the bathrooms could be cleaner.

data.title: Food
data.text: This is a great Mexican restaurant with a great menu and many excellent menu closes to choose from. Perfect for the whole family or out with the gang in the sports bar. Prices aren't bad, so it is a good value.

data.title: Love this place!!!
data.text: Love love love this!!! Chips and salsa are great!!   Food is also.  Thanks!! Service was fast and we left satisfied.  Thanks again!

data.title: Hungry
data.text: Was very satisfied with my food, exceptional food. Friendly staff, very happy with my choice to eat here everything was great you will enjoy the place come and enjoy.

data.title: Luis is the Best!
data.text: We have been coming here for years, and the food leans more toward fresh Yucatan flavors, rather than the ubiquitous  Northern Mexican fare you find everywhere else. They change the menu frequently with new offerings, while still keeping the old favorites on hand. The margaritas are excellent and the atmosphere is bright and well appointed with colorful murals everywhere, but it's not too noisy with each different corner really giving you the feel of a small restaurant.  Good place for a family, a couple or a celebration.  BUT!  We come back again and again because of LUIS, who is our favorite waiter anywhere.  He is thoughtful, kind, knows us and treats us not only like valued customers, but friends.  Luis is hands down the best part of our experience.  Yes, it's a chain, but somehow, they have managed to hire the right people, construct the right atmosphere and build the right menu to make it all feel like a very personal experience.  We love this restaurant and take friends here when they come from out of town if they really want to experience fine Mexican cuisine.

data.title: After over 30+ years I think today was our last time...has gone down hill
data.text:
We have been going to this El Torito in La Mesa for YEARS...it used to be sometimes 2X a week and more recently remember how we used to like it it started being 2X a month but recently as in the past 6 months or so we noticed how things had changed from being a place we knew would be good to it being hit and miss. I do not know if we will attempt this again.

Today's experience...got there when it was super slow and was sat in a room alone and she said the waiter would be right with and we were in good hands. A waiter shows up ten minutes later and said he didn't even know we were there! The person seating people forgot about us in a span of one minute. We told him how we had just driven 6 hours and had just gotten back into town. We were exhausted. We wanted a quick meal and then go home to rest. 

 He got back to us with our drinks and chips and salsa and we gave him our order. By now another table came in and then a huge party of maybe 12 people. 40 minutes passed and although we did get our guacamole and chips and salads we still didn't have our entrees. He kept saying I promise it will be out in a minute. We told him after the entrees finally came out to just bring us to go boxes because we had to leave. He said he would ask about taking 20% off the bill. It wasn't even the 20%, we just wanted to eat and go home. 

He brings the boxes back and we have probably been waiting at this point an hour or more after getting seated and he brings the bill. No 20% off, no complimentary nothing. If he was not going to do it he should not have said anything.

 The kicker was when he left the bill there was no pen to sign it!!!!  My husband had already gone to the car. I had to dig and dig in my purse and come up with a pen. The last few experiences we have had with this La Mesa El Torito are similar with the exception of when we have an older Mexican gentleman as our waiter. He serves with class and seems to go out of his way as in above and beyond to make sure things are right.

 I cannot imagine it was this waiter's fault our food was so late. He kept checking on us and the restaurant was not full at all when we ordered so it was poor management. No one knowing about us when we were seated, waiting forever for the food, saying he would take 20% off the bill and didn't....I think we are done with this restaurant.

 It takes a lot for me to write a negative review but something is really wrong with this restaurant. We wanted a nice relaxing meal after a long drive for business over the weekend it it turned out to be stressful and frustrating.

data.title: Best Patron Margaritas
data.text: We havent dined in the dining area of the restaurant because we enjoy sitting at the bar speaking with Miguel who in my opinion is one of the best bartenders ever. He friendly, funny and has an infectious laugh. But he also makes the best Patron and Cadillac Margaritas.

data.title: Sometimes Good, Sometimes Only So-So
data.text: We were seated immediately, but in a noisy area. We have eaten at a number of El Torito sites, many times times at this location. Sometimes the food is good, other times only so-so. Last night the food was only so-so. We were celebrating my birthday. The service was very slow because they were understaffed. They did bring a free flan to celebrate my birthday, sang "Happy Birthday" to me, and I had a $5.00 discount coupon. But, all in all, it was only a so-so experience.

data.title: Slow service
data.text:
Went here for a late lunch. The place was very loud with people watching the sports channel.
We got seated after 10 minutes of wait. The food we ordered took almost half an hour to arrive.
I ordered street tacos which was ok. My friend ordered enchilada which was kinda dry.

data.title: Great place to have a good time!
data.text: The food is excellent and service great! And do not forget to visit the bar! One of the best Mexican restrants around here.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: We were seated within 5 minutes of walking through the door.  Very good for a busy Sunday at this restaurant.  The atmosphere was good.  They have a bar area which you may sit at to enjoy the games on tv.  Our seating was in a quieter area perfect for 3 friends.  Our server was courteous and quick to get our drinks.  Our lunch portions were generous and filling.  I also ordered the flan.  i rate a place by their chips & salsa and the flan.  Both were very good at this place.  I will return even if it is just to sit down for dessert.  Great Sunday place.

data.title: Not your typical chain restaurant!
data.text: We ate dinner here on a trip to San Diego because we were shopping nearby and it was getting late.  It was an wonderful experience -- far more than we expected from a restaurant chain.  We started with delicious Cadillac Margaritas, made from 1800 Tequila, and served with a shot of Grand Marnier on the side. The salsa served with our chips was fresh and very tasty, and the side of guacamole we asked for was also excellent.  I chose the Steak Fajita salad, which is served tableside so that you can put the fajita meat and vegetables on the salad yourself. The fajita steak was as tender, flavorful and juicy as sirloin, and in addition to the fajita onions and peppers, the salad included romaine lettuce, cotija cheese, half an avocado sliced in lengths, roasted pepitas, and fresh pico de gallo.  A vinaigrette dressing is provided on the side, but I didn't use it because the oils and juices from the fajita meat and vegetables made a perfect dressing. My daughter ordered the Grilled halibut fajitas, which looked wonderful, but the fish apparently became overcooked on the fajita pan, because it was a little tough and without flavor.  The service at this El Torito was very good, the decor was attractive and interesting, and the booths and tables offer privacy for conversation.  I'd recommend this restaurant for anyone desiring good Mexican food in the La Mesa/San Diego area.

data.title: Sunday Brunch
data.text: We had a some family (18-20) down for a wedding and had placed a reservation for Sunday brunch. We arrived to find our reservation never made it out of the manager's book to the hostess. They quickly made room for us and we settled in for brunch. The omelette bar was great and they have a taco bar as well. Don't order the orange juice, it is better classified as water with orange coloring. Overall the food was good for value.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Great food but slow service.... Overall good value
